page.title: 13NEWTON'S FARM SWINDERBY.
page.content: {Mr. Donald Newton} is the farmer at this arable farm of 240 acres. There are two 6 acre tree plantations from the 1920's. The largest field is 40 acres and the smallest is 7 acres. The farm has the following diesel fueled{machinery and implements: a 1984 Massey Ferguson 565 Combine, a 1983 4 wheel drive M.F. Tractor, two 2 wheel drive tractors (1975,1981) a Caterpillar Track Tractor and 3 ploughs, 2 cultivators, 2 drills, a rotovator, a power harrow-disc harrow, a sprayer, a straw chopper, 2 augers, and 4 grain trailers. The {crops} are {rotated}on a 5 year cycle,2 years of wheat,2 of barley,and 1 year of break crops of oats or dried beans or dried peas. In 1985 there are 90 acres of{wheat,}96 of{barley,}24 of {peas}and 30 of{beans. }The farmer has some part time help.
